name: saint
text: the breakfast of champions.

name: dangelder
text: A comment left by dangelder was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by doinkydoink, Cyberbob, goocifer, king_of_pwns, darren_cuddy, cbchillcb, Satyr)

name: vweep
text: Even though Asherdan is probably more deserved of that chubby. No hate, Saint- but Asherdan has served his time in hell.

name: tangles
text: asherdan is a grinning wholly unrepentant lucifer to saint's loki, perhaps?

name: atticusonline
text: ha, he called you David Spade...that's terrible.

name: dropkickpikachu
text: Beef is just so goddamn matter-of-fact about it. He is going to win. That's all he's tryna say.

name: petitegitan
text: Sometimes you have to think of the most matter-of-fact ways to win an arguement.  Beef is the perfect cat to go to in a situation like that.

name: zem
text: this was my wallpaper for a few months

name: catachresis
text: When beef heard she would be going to prison he busted into a crate of Guinness

name: feetnotes
text: This strategy wins any argument. Guaranteed.

name: nurdbot
text: This strip speaks to people on what I feel about Paris Hilton.

name: epicurus
text: I would like to compete against Beef, I think I have a shot. I have been practicing.

name: numberkillinger
text: presumably by desensitising yourself to child murder?

name: fattypneumonia
text: Based on the things he's seen, and his hatred of rich annoying celebrity women (see Rachael Ray), Nice Pete would totally win this contest.

name: deancain29
text: my blood pressure would be so high. so high.

name: heavymetaljesus
text: Man.. I oughta try try that last method.

name: bovine
text: A comment left by bovine was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by robobogle, envika, ferdinand)

name: rowboat
text: No, those aren't Stella glasses. I was thinking Mimosas. But crispy ones, to be sure.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
Hmm, they look like pilsner glasses...cheap ones, but pilsner glasses nonetheless, which would be appropriate for Stellas, I suppose. And what kind of asshole would actually drink Stellas out of actual Stella glasses at their own house?

The answer is me. I would.

(Because I have 6 Stella glasses I got at a bar promotion night: "Drink a Stella, keep the glass")

name: blarghamagarky
text:
From my once retail days of selling designer crystal and china and silly things to rich white women, and coming from a family full of bar tenders,I will have to agree with pilsner glasses. Mimosas are typically served in champagne flutes, and I know the flared ones you are thinking of that mimosas are served in a lot (Christmas morning they were on the table for brunch, 2 parts oj 3 parts champagne) but those typically have a super thin base, almost being a stem, because champagne flutes are designed to retain carbonation and to be unaffected by hand temperature.

That was a stupid thing to type on a message board on the internet.

name: rowboat
text: No, it was informative. Thank you. So, to recap - they are not mimosas, nor are they crispy Stellas. And by the way, Ray is exactly the "kind of asshole" (your word, not mine) who would use the proper glass. That is because he comes correct!

name: i_love_kate
text: Pilsner seems closest. They look like Weitzen... However you spell that. Weißbier glasses, then. But Beef's glass is almost full, and there's no sign of any foam, so I might be wrong. Or Ray might not know how to pour Weißbier.

name: rumblefish
text: Rather than being drinking glasses of any sort I'm choosing to believe that they're pausing in the middle of making their own lava-lamps to have this discussion.

name: heccibiggs
text: Wait a minute. Is a Mimosa the same as Buck's fucking Fizz??

name: rowboat
text: NO

name: i_love_kate
text: Except yes.

name: rowboat
text: OK

name: cagliostro
text:
I shall never again refer to that particular concoction as anything other than Buck's fucking Fizz. So assonant, and so deserved. Thank you, heccibiggs.

Although I am starting to get Kill Bill flashbacks.

name: varnish
text: This was my first Achewood. I was not sure what to think of it at the time.

name: geysershitdick
text: Shouldn't the exercise bike be facing away from Paris Hilton?

name: buttermoths
text: I guess the idea is that your boiling rage gives you superhuman stamina.

name: saru
text: That, and your desire to run that skank down with a bike.

name: semiquaver
text: Somewhere, you add up the comment and the avatar and a very specific voice emerges.

name: buttermoths
text: They ALL get ass-raped and murdered down here. When you're down here with us, you'll be ass-raped and murdered TOO! Let go. Be afraid. You all taste so much better when you're afraid.

name: semiquaver
text: Again with the comment/avatar perfection.

name: c_dizzle
text: To quote David Cross: "..rich...giggling cunt."

name: lobster_mobster
text: Beef puts all our lousy E!-channel watching, scornfully laughing asses to shame.

name: quantumcasaba
text: I like the qualifier, "..based on how I feel."

name: bluecarrot
text: I don't know if this would have worked if the celeb was not Paris Hilton. It probably would BUT NOT AS WELL

name: jeet
text: I like how Teodor just sits there, watching the conversation unfold as if it were a tennis match. Or pong game.

name: tekende
text: Teodor is considering the blood pressure idea, thinking "that's not fair, my blood pressure wouldn't go very high because I have been eating Cheerios for breakfast the past few weeks."

name: gussiejives
text: Beef says what we all think.

text: I have to say, I like what you're doing here

text: I concur, without xiaomimi I wouldn't read the blogs at all (because as a newbie still reading through the archive I wouldn't have known they were made yet).

name: heccibiggs
text: You sometimes have to wonder how bored Ray is, to come up with these sorts of ideas for entertainment.

name: heccibiggs
text: Man. I wrote this six months ago? This doesn't even sound like something I'd say. What the hell happened?

name: boopy
text: god, fucking brilliant.

name: tbtabby
text: The new episode of Lewis Black's Root of All Evil features Paris Hilton vs. Dick Cheney. Greg Giraldo's arguing for Paris. I'm watching it right now.

name: tbtabby
text: It was a close descision, but Cheney won. Maybe things would've gone differently if Beef had been arguing for Paris Hilton.

name: dumase
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: singtralala
text: that last experiment sounds alot like the thigs we did back in school (psych)

name: carlyle
text: Teodor only looks surprised at the three page essay, but not the part about him reacting more angrily towards a woman talking on a cell phone and shooting small children.

name: deusoma
text: Teodor says nothing in this strip, yet his face contributes so much.

name: duperando
text: Heh. Teodor's essentially a prop in this little skit. He doesn't say a word and just turns his head back and forth between the two crazy cats.
